content.description:
The epinephrine signaling pathway plays a role in regulating glucose homeostasis in muscle cells. The signaling pathway is activated by the binding of epinephrine to the beta-2 adrenergic receptor. A simplified model of the epinephrine signaling pathway is represented in FigureÂ 1.

Figure 1. A simplified model of the epinephrine signaling pathway in muscle cells
content.question: Based on Figure 1, which of the following statements best describes the epinephrine signaling pathway?

choices.label: It involves the opening and closing of ion channels.
In involves enzymes activating other enzymes.
It involves changes in the expression of target genes.
It involves protons moving down a concentration gradient.

content.answer: In involves enzymes activating other enzymes.

skill.text: 2.A: Describe characteristics of visual representations of biological concepts and processes.
